# Python Quiz 3 - Advanced

â“ What is the purpose of Python decorators? ğŸ”´

ğŸ“ Modify or enhance functions without changing their code
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ Decorators allow you to modify or enhance functions by wrapping them with additional functionality without changing their original code.

---

â“ Which Python feature allows for lazy evaluation? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Generators
âš™ï¸ Lists
ğŸ§± Tuples
ğŸ“¦ Dictionaries

ğŸ’¡ Generators provide lazy evaluation by yielding values one at a time, conserving memory for large datasets.

---

â“ What does the `__init__` method do in Python classes? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Initialize object attributes when creating instances
âš™ï¸ Define class methods
ğŸ§± Create class variables
ğŸ“¦ Handle class inheritance

ğŸ’¡ The `__init__` method is a constructor that initializes object attributes when creating new instances of a class.

---

â“ Which Python concept allows functions to remember their state? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Closures
âš™ï¸ Recursion
ğŸ§± Iterators
ğŸ“¦ Decorators

ğŸ’¡ Closures allow inner functions to remember and access variables from their enclosing scope even after the outer function has finished executing.

---

â“ What is the purpose of Python's `with` statement? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Automatically manage resource cleanup
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ The `with` statement automatically handles resource cleanup, such as closing files, even if exceptions occur.

---

â“ Which Python feature allows for multiple inheritance? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Multiple base classes in class definition
âš™ï¸ Function overloading
ğŸ§± Method chaining
ğŸ“¦ Operator overloading

ğŸ’¡ Python supports multiple inheritance by allowing a class to inherit from multiple base classes simultaneously.

---

â“ What does the `@property` decorator do? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Convert methods to read-only attributes
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ The `@property` decorator allows you to access a method like an attribute, providing getter functionality.

---

â“ Which Python concept allows for dynamic attribute access? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ `__getattr__` and `__setattr__` methods
âš™ï¸ Regular attributes
ğŸ§± Static methods
ğŸ“¦ Class methods

ğŸ’¡ These special methods allow classes to dynamically handle attribute access and modification.

---

â“ What is the purpose of Python's `super()` function? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Call methods from parent classes
âš™ï¸ Create new objects
ğŸ§± Delete objects
ğŸ“¦ Modify objects

ğŸ’¡ The `super()` function allows you to call methods from parent classes, useful in inheritance scenarios.

---

â“ Which Python feature allows for context management? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Context managers with `__enter__` and `__exit__`
âš™ï¸ Exception handling
ğŸ§± Resource management
ğŸ“¦ Memory management

ğŸ’¡ Context managers implement `__enter__` and `__exit__` methods to handle setup and cleanup operations.

---

â“ What does the `@staticmethod` decorator do? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Define methods that don't require instance or class
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ Static methods don't receive the instance or class as the first argument and can be called on the class directly.

---

â“ Which Python concept allows for operator overloading? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Special methods like `__add__`, `__sub__`
âš™ï¸ Regular methods
ğŸ§± Static methods
ğŸ“¦ Class methods

ğŸ’¡ Special methods allow you to define how operators work with custom objects.

---

â“ What is the purpose of Python's `__slots__` attribute? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Optimize memory usage by restricting attributes
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Simplify syntax
ğŸ“¦ Reduce code complexity

ğŸ’¡ `__slots__` restricts the attributes that can be assigned to instances, reducing memory usage.

---

â“ Which Python feature allows for metaprogramming? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Metaclasses
âš™ï¸ Regular classes
ğŸ§± Functions
ğŸ“¦ Modules

ğŸ’¡ Metaclasses allow you to create and modify classes programmatically, enabling advanced metaprogramming techniques.

---

â“ What does the `@classmethod` decorator do? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Define methods that receive the class as first argument
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ Class methods receive the class as the first argument and can be called on the class or instances.

---

â“ Which Python concept allows for descriptor protocol? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ `__get__`, `__set__`, `__delete__` methods
âš™ï¸ Regular attributes
ğŸ§± Static methods
ğŸ“¦ Class methods

ğŸ’¡ The descriptor protocol allows objects to customize attribute access, assignment, and deletion.

---

â“ What is the purpose of Python's `__call__` method? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Make objects callable like functions
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ The `__call__` method allows instances to be called like functions.

---

â“ Which Python feature allows for abstract base classes? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ `abc` module with abstract methods
âš™ï¸ Regular classes
ğŸ§± Interfaces
ğŸ“¦ Protocols

ğŸ’¡ The `abc` module allows you to define abstract base classes with abstract methods that must be implemented by subclasses.

---

â“ What does the `@functools.lru_cache` decorator do? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Cache function results to avoid recomputation
âš™ï¸ Improve performance
ğŸ§± Reduce memory usage
ğŸ“¦ Simplify syntax

ğŸ’¡ This decorator caches function results using an LRU (Least Recently Used) strategy to avoid recomputing expensive operations.

---

â“ Which Python concept allows for coroutines? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ `async` and `await` keywords
âš™ï¸ Regular functions
ğŸ§± Generators
ğŸ“¦ Threads

ğŸ’¡ Coroutines use `async` and `await` keywords to enable asynchronous programming and cooperative multitasking.

---

â“ What is the purpose of Python's `__new__` method? ğŸ”´

ğŸ“ Control object creation process
âš™ï¸ Initialize object attributes
ğŸ§± Handle object destruction
ğŸ“¦ Manage object lifecycle

ğŸ’¡ The `__new__` method controls the object creation process and is called before `__init__`.
